oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of President Franklin D. Roosevelt and Secretary of State Cordell Hull, circa 1934
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of President Franklin D. Roosevelt and Secretary of State Cordell Hull, circa 1934 sitting in the back seat of an open car. Cordell Hull was born in Pickett County Tennessee. He became a lawyer and had an illustrious career in which he served as Judge, Fifth Judicial District, Congressman Tennessee House of Representatives, as United States Congressman and later Senator from Tennessee. He resigned the position of Senator to serve as Secretary of State from 1933-1944 under Roosevelt and received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1945. Forms part of the Nashville Banner Archives. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Roosevelt, Franklin D. (Franklin Delano), 1882-1945; Hull, Cordell, 1871-1955
